Looking at the board, we see several apples on the top rows: at (5,9), (7,9), (8,9), and on row 7 at (3,7) and (1,7). The closest target appears to be the apple at (8,9) since its Manhattan distance from (9,5) is 1 (horizontal) + 4 (vertical) = 5 moves. 

Our legal moves from (9,5) are:
• UP to (9,6)
• LEFT to (8,5)
• DOWN to (9,4)
• RIGHT to (10,5) which is off the board

Since our goal is to head toward the cluster of apples in the higher rows (especially (8,9)), moving DOWN won’t help us and RIGHT is not allowed. Moving UP keeps us moving toward the top edge, and although LEFT would get us directly one column over, it doesn’t advance our row. With the apple cluster clearly in the northern part of the board, advancing upward seems the most natural path.

Thus, by moving UP to (9,6), we continue our climb toward the target zone while maintaining safe separation from the enemy snake (which is far away at (1,2)).

Next move: UP.
